summary: The Armenian Genocide Education Act directs the Librarian of Congress to establish a program supporting Armenian Genocide education. This includes developing and disseminating educational resources (digital and print), providing professional development for educators, and encouraging the adoption of these resources into school curricula. The Librarian will also maintain an online resource section. The bill defines key terms like "Armenian Genocide," "denial," and "distortion," and authorizes appropriations of $2,000,000 annually for five years to carry out these activities.
